When installing JIRA 6.4 , selecting the JIRA + Service Desk Package will result in an error page as seen below after completing the installation :

* JIRA Service Desk

!64-1.png|thumbnail!

!6.4-2.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43423].
  {panel}

Dear all,

In order to comply with German (and EU to-be) laws regarding privacy and the right to be forgotten online, we are looking for an extra feature in Jira.
So far, when an user is asking for account deletion, Jira allows to do this, provided they have no bug report assigned or reported. It is possible to change all these fields, so it's not a major issue.
But, if the user commented in several bug reports, their posts are just left without account but their nickname is left attached to the post, which can still be an issue.
It would be great if Jira could provide an option to rename the user posts on deletion to a chosen nickname (so that we can put "Deleted user") for instance.

Here is an example bug report with said deleted user, but left nickname: https://jira.reactos.org/browse/CORE-4495

With my best regards,

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43419].
  {panel}

If I press 'l' to modify labels, and accidentally remove one, I typically try to add it back. 

But the form doesn't act like it is a label that is available--it acts like it is new. 

So I have to retype the entire thing rather than using the autofill. This is an error-prone approach. Sometimes, just to be safe, I decide to just hit escape and redo everything. 

This isn't so bad if I just pressed 'l' while reading a ticket. But if I had hit 'e', then I have to remember everything else I did.
fields.summary: Removing a label then changing your mind is hard

fields.description:
h3. Summary
DefaultGadgetSpecFactory::fetchObjectAndCache does not use current logged in user credentials or request cookie so it fails behind a proxy with basic auth

h3. Environment

Basic Auth proxy

h4. apache site enabled

{code}
# JIRA AJP Proxy Configuration:
<VirtualHost *:80>
ServerName jsimon.atlassian.local

<Proxy *>
        Order deny,allow
        Allow from all
</Proxy>
CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/access.log combined
LogLevel                debug
ProxyRequests           Off
ProxyPass               /jira       ajp://localhost:8010/jira
ProxyPassReverse        /jira       ajp://localhost:8010/jira

<Location /jira>
        AuthType Basic
        AuthName "Jira Basic Auth"
        AuthUserFile /etc/apache2/users/jira
        Require valid-user
</Location>
</VirtualHost>
{code}

h4. JIRA  servers.xml
{code}
<Context path="/jira" docBase="${catalina.home}/atlassian-jira" reloadable="false" useHttpOnly="true">
{code}
{code}
<Connector port="8010"
                   maxThreads="150"
                   minSpareThreads="25"
                   enableLookups="false"
                   protocol="AJP/1.3"
                   address="127.0.0.1" />
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. From JIRA
Click Add new gadgets button on a Dashboard

h4. Manually
Enter http://localhost:8090/jira/rest/config/1.0/directoryitems/local.json on the browser

The list of gadgets will be smaller than expected.

h3. Analysis:
The effect is that less gadgets are retrieved this way than without the proxy. This is partially solved by APDEX-198.

When LocalGadgetSpecFactory::getGadgetSpec fails to retrieve a gadget if falls back in DefaultLocalGadgetSpecFactory:
{code}
private GadgetSpec fetchObjectAndCache(Uri url, boolean ignoreCache) throws GadgetException {
    HttpRequest request = new HttpRequest(url).setIgnoreCache(ignoreCache);
    request.setCacheTtl((int) (refresh / 1000));

    HttpResponse response = fetcher.fetch(request);
    ...
{code}

The only header in this request is X-shinding-dos: on, request results on a Gateway timeout (HTTP error 504). Apache error logs show:

{code}
[Fri May 15 17:51:47.063013 2015] [authz_core:debug] [pid 28554:tid 139774182508288] mod_authz_core.c(802): [client 10.0.2.2:56556] AH01626: authorization result of Require valid-user : denied (no authenticated user yet)
{code}
fields.summary: DefaultGadgetSpecFactory performs anonymous requests

fields.description:
To reproduce the current behavior - 

Select a project
Select the Road Map tab from the sidebar
Select a "Fix Version"
Select "View in Issue Navigator" to view issues related to fix version

Result: Get advanced query mode with a query like "project = 14500 AND fixVersion = 28821 ORDER BY priority DESC, key ASC". Note fixVersion and project are numbers, not written values.

Expect: Get basic query mode with visual filters. At least, be able to switch to basic without having to remember and type out the letter-accurate fields from memory.

Justification for fix
I am unable to easily view filters and visually compare fix versions when my fix version (for a sprint, for example) is written as a number as opposed "Week of May 18". This is not the only entry point for this issue. Each time I hit it, I have to retype the fix version and all other filters manually, then switch to basic mode.
fields.summary: Issue navigator should not default to advanced query mode with unusable IDs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43405].
  {panel}

*To Reproduce:*
Set com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers to DEBUG to see how JIRA converts JQL into Lucene queries.

Create two issues with summaries:
Placer One: MBL-RFT-00063
Placer One: MBL-RFTO-000045
*MBL-*
Search in navigator:
summary ~ "\"Placer One: MBL-*\""
Converted Lucene query:
+pq_support_summary:"Placer One MBL"

*Results:*
As you can see above, JIRA actually removes the Wildcard character when generating the Lucene query.
The removal of the Wildcard character makes sense because Lucene does not support wild card searches for phrases. See [official lucene documentation|http://lucene.apache.org/core/3_3_0/queryparsersyntax.html] for reference.

- Wildcard Searches
Lucene supports single and multiple character wildcard searches within single terms (not within phrase queries).

When you put \" \" it forces JIRA to convert the search as a phrase, instead of individual terms. The phrase "Placer One: MBL" matches the ticket's summary. 

*MBL-R*
Search in navigator:
summary ~ "\"Placer One: MBL-R*\""

*Converted Lucene query:*
+pq_support_summary:"Placer One MBL R"

Again, notice how JIRA removes the wildcard character as its not supported.
This search fails because the phrase "Placer One MBL R" doesn't match the ticket summary. (that extra a without the -!)

*Workaround:*
One workaround is to search on a per-term basis (so wild cards can be used) instead of searching with an entire phrase. So you need to remove the escaped inverted commas. 
Here's some sample JQL that successfully returns the issues:
summary ~ "Placer One MBL R*"
summary ~ "Placer One MBL RT*"
summary ~ "Placer One M* R*"
summary ~ "Placer One M*  RFT*"

*Notice how removing the \" \" from the search tells Lucene to search on a per-term basis, allowing us to use the trailing wildcard characters.*

*Suggestion:*
This is fixed in [Lucene 4.8.0|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-1486] JIRA 6.4 is on Lucene 3.3.0. In future versions use 4.8.0 to allow for more dynamic search functions with JQL.
fields.summary: Wildcards not supported in phrases.

h3. Summary:

Doing a REST call for the {{/rest/api/2/component}} POST method sending a invalid lead user will lead to inconsistent results.


h3. Steps to Reproduce:

Do a REST call for the {{/rest/api/2/component}} POST method with a invalid username in *leadUserName*


h3. Expected Results:

The API should not create the component and return a error about the invalid username


h3. Actual Results:

The API will return a 400 response, which is not documented in the API documentation for this method, and will create the component in the project.

h3. Workaround:

No available workaround.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h5. Summary
Would like a feature that allows users to search for all issues that have a particular string within it's name, similar to the summary/ description field search.
h5. For example: 
{code}project = "Test*"{code} 
or
{code}project ~ "Test"{code}

h5. Actual Result:
JIRA JQL throws an error saying there's no project with the name Test*.

h5. Expected behaviour
JIRA returns all issues with test being a part of the project name.

h5. Actual Solution:
User can search for issues in those projects using "projects in"
{code}project in("Test 1","Test 2",......){code}

_Problem with this is it is not scalable if user has lots of projects in their JIRA instance which start with Test._
fields.summary: Allow wildcard or '~' symbol to search for project/category name in JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43397].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Replying to a JIRA issue email without the issue key in the subject results in a new ticket being created as the 'In-Reply-To' value is not being parsed correctly.


h3. Environment
Cloud
Server



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send an email to JIRA
# Forward the confirmation email to another email address
# Remove the issue key from the subject line and reply to all


h3. Expected Results
JIRA should parse the 'In-Reply-To' line within the message header and match it to the existing ticket


h3. Actual Results
JIRA opens a new ticket

What is seen is that the current versions of JIRA Server generates email notifications with mail headers such as:

{noformat}
Message-ID: <398968471.2.1431682003072.JavaMail.andy@dev-jira>
In-Reply-To: <JIRA.12400.1431681970000@Atlassian.JIRA>
References: <JIRA.12400.1431681970000@Atlassian.JIRA> <JIRA.12400.1431681970299@dev-jira>
{noformat}

When a reply is sent the headers are included, and used by the standard JIRA mail handlers (amongst others) 

[MailThreadManager|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/jira/6.4/reference/com/atlassian/jira/mail/MailThreadManager.html]

however, in the method:

{code:java}
private Issue parseIssueFromMessageId(final String messageId)
{code}

An example In-Reply-To header value of:
{noformat}
<JIRA.12400.1431681970000@Atlassian.JIRA>
{noformat}

Is split based on . into:
{noformat}
[<JIRA, 12400, 1431681970000@Atlassian, JIRA>]
{noformat}

The method above tries to parse \[2] which is '1431681970000@Atlassian' into a Long which throws a RuntimeException.


h3.Workaround
Ensure that the issue key is referenced in the subject line of the email
fields.summary: In-Reply-To processing is broken - header not being parsed correctly

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Issue assignee and reporter is kept when issue is moved to another project, which in the new project, this current assignee and reporter has no permission (Assignable User, Create Issue)

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.4.4

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create User *A*, *B* and *U*
# Create Project *P* and *Q*
# *User A* is in the Project Lead, Developer and default assignee roles for *Project P*
# *User B* is in the Project Lead, Developer and default assignee roles for *Project Q*
# *User U* is in the User role for *Project P*
# Have *User U* create an issue in *Project P*, so it will be assigned to *User A* automatically
# Have *User A* move the issue to *Project Q*

h4. Actual Results
Issue is moved to *Project Q* successfully, without the need of changing the assignee or reporter of the issue

h4. Expected Results
# In the *Move Issue* action, enforce the need of changing the Reporter and/or Assignee to fit the configuration on the target project. OR
# Set the Assignee and Reporter field to the default role for that project

h4. Notes
Need to update [*Moving an Issue*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Moving+an+Issue] documentation in JIRA, to reflect the correct expected behavior
fields.summary: Issue Assignee and Reporter is kept when moving an issue, even though user has no permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43394].
  {panel}

JIRA's current behavior is to hide fields that has empty (null) value. The purpose is to prevent those fields to clutter the issue view screen. However, some fields need a permanent visibility even though it is empty, as it will need to be added in the later stage/status.

Therefore, allow options to enforce Custom Field visibility in the issue view screen, through the Field Configuration page.

h3. Workaround
Add a *Default Value* into the custom field in the *Field Configuration* page, to enforce its visibility
fields.summary: Allow options to enforce Custom Field visibility in the Issue View screen

fields.description:
In Jira we have “Custom Field” (e.g. Story Points) (af3) which is visible on Issues screen. For this field we have translated description in English (UK) via *Issue > Fields > Custom Fields* and option “Translate” (cf2). 

If user with English profile (p3) is logged in Jira, he sees on Issue Screen untranslated descriptions for this Custom Field (cf1), although we translated this field.
fields.summary: Localization for Custom Fields is not working in Issues Screens

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The workflow diagram does not utilise user provided translations for issue statuses. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Standalone instance. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a a new project, for example Scrum Software Project.
# Create Translations for the workflow for a specific language from: *_Admin Cog_* > *Issues* > *Statuses* > *Translate Statuses*
# Create an issue. 
# Using a user logged in using the language that the workflow statuses were translated into, access the issue.
# Observe: When accessing the Workflow Diagram of an issue, the digram presents the workflow statuses in their original language. 
# Observe: Other parts of the UI are using the correct translated statuses (such as the issue browser).

h3. Expected Results
The Workflow Diagram should display the translated status.

h3. Actual Results
The user does not see the translated statuses in the Workflow diagram. 

h3. Notes
This was tested with a custom workflow, and a Out-of-the-box workflow (JIRA Scrum Project) in JIRA 7.1.1 with the same results. The Workflow Diagram always displayed the original workflow status when the translated status was expected.

h3. Original Bug Report
states are initially created in German language and are translated via *Administration > Issue Attributes > Statuses* and option "Translate Statuses" in English (p1.). 

If we are logged in jira with user, who has profile set to English (UK) language (p3), we are *NOT* seeing translated statuses in workflow diagram in English(UK) but in original German language (p2).

NOTE: Transitions used in workflow are correct visible in English.

h3. Workaround

There is currently no known workaround.
fields.summary: Workflow diagram states are not translated

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently, there is no clear documentation of the configuration of JIRA Data Center clusters with respect to the use of multicast used between nodes, this information should be disclosed in the documentation to make the product more serviceable.

h3. Expected Results
There should be some documentation regarding Multicasting communicated in and throughout the documentation of the JIRA Data Center product.

h3. Actual Results
No clear documentation currently exists.

h3. Notes
JIRA Data Center allows (at least) the configuration of the following [ehcache|http://ehcache.org/] properties with regards to UDP multicasting:

* ehcache.multicast.timeToLive

* ehcache.listener.hostName

* ehcache.listener.port

* ehcache.multicast.address

* ehcache.multicast.port
fields.summary: JIRA Data Center needs documentation on Multicast UDP Configuration
Allow search by matching values in fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43373].
  {panel}

This is similar to JRA-28436, but that item has been Closed.

My company purchased Zephyr for JIRA to enable test case management within JIRA, but I have noticed this has created some instances where the data is not helpful.

Our Directors are now looking to the Road Map feature to show progress on the version of various projects. The problem that arises if we have all the Test issue types included in the totals for a version. So if a version has 20 Development Tasks that are resolved and 200 Tests that are left open for regression testing, the 200 Tests are causing the number of unresolved items to go way beyond where it actually is.

To have the ability to remove certain issue types would greatly benefit us.
fields.summary: Filter Issue Types out of Road Map

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43368].
  {panel}

h4. Current scenario:
'Assignee' field cannot be set as required on Field Configuration. The only option to have assignee required is upon changing the "Allow unassigned issues" setting under General Configuration, which affects all projects. 

h4. Work-around:
Assignee field can be marked as required upon using a 3rd party add-on, as per steps listed on [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Making+'Assignee'+field+required+when+'Allow+unassigned+issues'+is+turned+ON+in+General+Configuration] article.

h4. Suggestion:
Allow "Assignee" field to be set as required on Field Configuration schemes, like any other field.
fields.summary: Allow 'Assignee' field to be required when 'Allow unassigned issues' is turned ON in General Configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43367].
  {panel}

Hi,
   Recently I had an issue about the Postgres JDBC driver and I found an inconsistence at JIRA documents.
   The standalone installation of JIRA does not require changing the JDBC driver if JIRA is not WAR (Connecting JIRA to PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL]), but the [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms] document says or seems to say that he DB version should match the JDBC version. This information is causing some noise at the customers and took me some time to understand what should I do. I think is important to clear this out to reduce this friction.

   I'm not sure about the solution. Maybe is recommend leave the old JDBC 9.0 with newer versions of Postgres since this is the bundle driver or is recommend follow the JIRA war process to install the JDBC new driver. The comment from James Rice (at references below) resumes this inconsistence.
   
   References for this request:
   * Issue [JSP-231367|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-231367];
   * James Rice comment at Jan 28, 2015 from [Connecting JIRA to PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL] page.

Thanks a lot,
Daniel P Santos
fields.summary: Inconsistent documentation about not changing Postgres JDBC driver for JIRA standalone

fields.description:
We're using JIRA 6.2.7. When I click the icon that says "A permanent link to a comment" that's displayed to the upper right of every comment I see this behavior (FF, Chrome and IE 10):

1) My browser follows the link, showing the issue and highlighting the comment

2) The URL shows the full link, but 200 msec later, the URL shortens to just show the issue ID.

- For example, the URL shortens from
-- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34998?focusedCommentId=605922&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-605922
- To
-- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34998

I assume this is a kind of regression bug.

This issue is reproducible in this issue tracker https://jira.atlassian.com as well. See attachment. GIF demonstrates the appearing of permalink in the URL bar for short time. After finishing of loading page the link is replaced to issue ID link.
fields.summary: Permalink to comments works incorrectly
Remove delay when showing an attachment

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
1) Navigate to: https://jira.atlassian.com
2) Create New Ticket or Edit Existing Ticket.
3) Upload an Attachment with: / or \ in the file name
4) The UI of JIRA will say: File "Austin:Bug.png" was not uploaded
: contains the invalid character '{1}'. Please rename the file and try again.

*Expected Result*
I expect this to be supported as a character, and expect my file to be uploaded.

*Actual Result*
My file errors to upload and the UI provides a user message: File "Austin:Bug.png" was not uploaded
: contains the invalid character '{1}'. Please rename the file and try again.

*Additional Information*
Although the application does not "error" because the UI indicates to the user that I cannot use \ or / I would expect it to work. Therefor, I am create this Enhancement Request.
fields.summary: Unable to Upload Attachments with "/" or "\" in the file name.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users without the "JIRA Users" global permission but with the "JIRA Administrators" global permission cannot delete issue links. They can see the link on the issue, but when they click on the "trash" icon, there is a spinning wheel for 1-2 seconds and nothing happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an user with the JIRA Administrator global permission only
# Create a project
# Create two tickets
# Link them
# Attempt to remove the link

h3. Expected Results
The issue link is removed accordingly after a confirmation pop-up.

h3. Actual Results
The link is not removed after a 1-2 seconds spinning wheel and no confirmation pop-up appears. The following appears in the atlassian-jira-security.log:
{noformat}
2015-05-12 16:27:00,363 http-bio-8817-exec-19 anonymous 987x2570x1 uuw12l 192.168.10.125 /secure/DeleteLink.jspa The user 'username' is NOT AUTHORIZED to perform this request
{noformat}
 
h3.Solution / Workaround

Just adding the user / group the user belongs to, to the JIRA Users global permission should do the trick.
fields.summary: User cannot delete Issue Links

fields.description:
*Expected behavior:*  Having navigated to a page > 1 in Issue Navigator search results, clicking Tools > Bulk Change: current page, the bulk editor returns the issues on that page.

*Actual behavior:* Clicking Tools > Bulk Change: current page, the bulk editor returns the issues listed on Page 1 of the Issue Navigator results.

*Steps to reproduce:*
In the Issue Navigator
# Search for issues in JIRA, make sure the # of results returned is > 100. Make a note of the issues that appear in page 1 of the results.
# Click the right arrow or page number to navigate to a page other than Page 1.  Make note of the issues  on this page.
# Click *Tools* then select *Bulk Change: current page*
# Note the issue IDs listed are the same as on Page 1 of Issue Navigator results rather than the expected results from a subsequent page. 

*Workaround*
# Follow the above steps. 
#  At the end of the process, click the *Back* button on your browser to return to the Issue Navigator Results.
# Select Tools > Bulk Change: current page again.
# The proper results will appear in the bulk editor.
fields.summary: Bulk Change: current page functionality always shows list from Page 1 regardless of actual current page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43350].
  {panel}

*Summary*

Custom Field Wiki Style Renderer Has *User Mention* Button Which Custom Field Doesn't auto-complete

Step to reproduce:

- Create a custom field with *Text Field (multi-line)*
- Assign to any screen
- Navigate to *Field Configuration* page (or press "gg" and search for Field Configuration)
- Click on *Configure* button on any field configuration that contained your custom field.
- Navigate to your custom field and click on "Renderers" button.
- Choose *Wiki Style Renderer*
- The custom field will look like the below image:
* !add user mention menu option.png|thumbnail!
- By using @ or clicking to Mention User, the wiki render will not auto-complete or search for users.

There is a [feature request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-32563] for this case.

*Workaround*
Copying the user mention for any other System field will add the mention as expected to the custom field.
fields.summary: Custom Field Wiki Style Renderer Has User Mention Button which doesn't auto-complete

h3. Notes

The new project sidebar makes heavy use of the {{sharepermission}} cache because it has to check the permissions of all the rapid view filters to build the rapid view select drop down.

 When an instance has more rapid views than the max size of the cache we just end up thrashing the cache as we continually evict entries that we just loaded. 

The max size of this cache had a hard limit of 3000 which was always a problem, but it really only became apparent with the usage pattern introduced by the sidebar.

There's an additional problem in JIRA Agile that affects the rendering of the browse projects page which is documented at GHS-12109. 

It is recommended that customers affected by this issue also deploy a version of JIRA Agile containing the fix for GHS-12109 as soon as it is available.
 
h3. Workaround

Disable the new project navigation as per [Configuring Project Navigation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Project+Navigation] to disable it globally, or [Project Navigation Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Project+navigation+options] on a per-user basis.
fields.summary: Project sidebar causes slow performance with a large number of Agile boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43346].
  {panel}

h4. Scenario
- Customer has 2 groups of users that can view an issue.
-* One group is like the users, they can create, view and edit issues, however, they cannot transition issue to a new state.
-* Second group involves users who can work on issues and then transition them to new states.
- Customer is aware that they can do this manually by setting conditions and the likes in Workflow, however since they have lots of workflows, this would not be scalable especially when it involves changing the group with permission to transition issues, they would need to do this for approximately 30 statuses while having roughly a hundred Workflows in their JIRA instance.

Can a feature be added that helps optimize how a Workflow can be modified easily based on the scenario described above?
fields.summary: Workflow Transition based on User Role

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira removing line break(s) after paste in IE in WIZIWIG editor 

h3. Environment
* Microsoft IE 10 and 11
* Other browsers (checked - Firefox/Safari/Chrome) are not affected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# copy several empty lines form any editor
# click the Comment button at the bottom of the issue
# paste the text into the comment input box

h3. Expected Results
!bug_ie_non.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
!bug_ie_paste.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Using "right click" + "paste".

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43337].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Users are unable to log into JIRA, receive a "Webpage has a redirect loop" error in browser

h3. Environment
JIRA 6.5-OD-03-002 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User logs into instance with their Username/Password
# After a few seconds, they receive an error indicating that the page has a redirect
!Redirect.png|thumbnail!

If User modifies the URL (for example: instanceurl/secure/ViewProfile.jspa) they can access the instance however when they click on the JIRA Home button, they receive another redirect indicating instanceurl/servicedesk/agent/onboarding. 

h3. Expected Results
Customer is able to login and access the JIRA Dashboard

h3. Actual Results
Upon login, page generates a Redirect Loop Error and does not load
 
h3. Workaround
Adding the affected User(s) to Service Desk Agents group, letting them login, and then remove them from Service Desk Agents group
fields.summary: Users are unable to log into Instance Receive Redirect Loop Error in Browser

fields.description:
Merging two versions clears the original data in a single value custom field

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a custom field of type Single Version Picker named SVP
2. Create a project TEST
3. Create two versions in the project TEST named  v1 and v2
4. Create 2 issues with SVP set to v1
5. Create 2 more issues with SVP set to v2
6. Go to the project TEST, and then Manage Versions
7. Choose Merge Versions and merge from v2 to v1

Expected Behavior:
All 4 issues should have a value of v1 for SVP

Observed Behavior:
The two issues which had a value of SVP of v2 now have not value set in the SVP field.


This also happens with the multi-version custom field type.
fields.summary: Merge Versions does not work with Single Version custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43327].
  {panel}

We have recently added some validators in our workflow, eg:
1.  only project leader (project role) is allowed to approved / accept an issue.
2. all sub-tasks need to be closed before resolved (which I think should be default design)

The problem is when the validators is not fullfilled the user gets no information, ie
1. workflow buttom is hidden when not in the user not in project role
2. when all sub-tasks is not closed, buttom to resolve is hidden

This is confusing and causes user to try to understand themselves what is wrong.

My proposals are
1. As a user I would like to see buttons for all transistions, and the ones I am not allowed to do is greyed out
2. As a user I would like to get a warning that not all sub-tasks are closed, and not possible to resolve.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to see buttons for all transistions and not allowed ones greyed out

fields.description:
Some Linux operating systems (like debian) are using (for example, but not limited to) the locale ({{LC_LANG}}) {{POSIX}} for rc-scripts. On a console there is often an {{UTF-8}} locale configured.

When Jira is configured to use MySQL and a password with locale specific characters (for example german umlaut-characters like {{äöüÄÖÜß}}) is used, Jira is connecting successfully while started over the installer or directly through console.

But when Jira is started via rc-script (the script installed from the installer in {{/etc/init.d/jira}}) it fails to connect to the database and throws many exceptions.

I suggest at least to mention this case in the documentation or on the jira setup-page.

A quick and dirty fix is to export the right locale in the rc-script: {{export LANG=de_DE.UTF-8}}. (This example is for a german setup, you can find your locale with the program {{locale}} in the command line).

This error also may occur with confluence and/or with other databases.
fields.summary: Jira (on Linux) can't connect through MySql when the configured locale is wrong and the password contains language/locale specific characters.

fields.description:
The email template for resolved issues is a little bit bad.
<User> resolved as Fixed

The german translation is bad, too:
<User> wurde als Behoben aufgelöst

For example the close issue email template is better:
English: <User> closed *an issue* as Fixed
German: <User> *hat einen Vorgang* als Behoben geschlossen

*Update*

Both should mention the [ISSUE-KEY] as a noun as per other templates.

English: <User> resolved [ISSUE-KEY] as Fixed
English: <User> closed [ISSUE-KEY] as Fixed.

The localised versions will have to be updated independently at translations.atlassian.com once the english message is updated.
fields.summary: Default "issue resolved" email template isn't complete in German

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43307].
  {panel}

Scenario tested:
* User limit not reached prior to import: DefaultProjectImporterManager spawns one thread per new user, all (or most) threads conclude that are seats available and add the new users to jira-use group, exceeding the license on the way.
* User limit reached prior to import: If the user limit was reached before the import all threads conclude there are no seats available and no user is added to the jira-use group.

This behaviour is not consistent, project import should be able to exceed the license or not regardless of previous state.

It happens both with roles enabled and disabled
fields.summary: Project import can exceed number of users only if the limit was not reached beforehand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43303].
  {panel}

In JIRA Service Desk we programmatically set an issue property to indicate that the issue came in through the "portal" or via "email" say.

We can find these issues  with JQL like

issue.property["request.channel.type"].value = "portal" 

This works as expected.

However if we want to find all issues where there is no property set then it does not work

issue.property["request.channel.type"].value is empty

returns nothing.  

I have an expectation that it would show all issues without the request.channel.type property set.
fields.summary: Issue properties in JQL fail to respect is empty

h3. Problem
I would like to restrict status changes in issues so that only the assignee can act upon them. Although this can be completed using conditions in workflow statuses, editing all transitions for every workflow can be time consuming and hard to maintain.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow administrators to accomplish this function more easily such as a GUI checkbox in a project/workflow.
 
h3. Workaround 
Add conditions in workflows to only allow assignees to transition issues.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator, I would like to be able to restrict transitions in issues without having to use advanced workflow configurations

fields.description:
When Jira is synced to LDAP, it was explained to me that Jira should never delete users that have been removed from LDAP.  I originally had the understanding that only users that had created content or been assigned issues would be kept around and simply marked as inactive.  We have recently had at least two users that have been added through LDAP, logged into Confluence that is linked with Jira (this is assumed because there are no records), checked their Confluence notifications, and accepted the OAuthtokens to allow Jira information to come through the activity feeds or other gadgets.  It doesn't appear that they had created any content nor been assigned any issues.  It doesn't even appear that they ever logged into Jira.  The users were then removed from LDAP, both Jira and  Confluence deleted the users.  I was then getting errors in the logs stating that a scheduled service was failing due to a token not being associated with a user.

2015-05-03 09:04:03,268 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.local_Worker-2 ERROR ServiceRunner     [atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'JiraPluginScheduler:Service Provider Session Remover' failed
com.atlassian.oauth.serviceprovider.InvalidTokenException: Token 'IKOZsoL8SARD7liLDSEEnjaLm5kQcO2E' is an access token, but has no user associated with it

I have already opened a support ticket and have a decent workaround to remove the tokens.  My concern is that this shouldn't be happening in the first place.  Even if a user has never created content, a check should still be made for items like Tokens before they are deleted.
fields.summary: Upon synchronisation JIRA deletes users leaving their OAuthTokens behind

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43284].
  {panel}

Hi,
I cannot find how to create a Feature Request so I hope this is the correct location.

As a user of JIRA to respond to customer tickets, I often find I'm doing the same tasks over and over. For example, when I set a ticket to Customer, I fill in the same Comment, set the Date to the currrent value and then click Customer. When I cancel a ticket, I set the same values every time and then click Cancel.

Wouldn't it be great to have a single button or link that I could press (perhaps in a sidebar) that would do it all for me?

I have not found anything similar after a quick search. There are references to default templates and some rule automation in Confluence and the Cloud but that's not what I'm looking for. I want to be able to define an action or default values in multiple fields whenever I click a button or link.

Can this functionality be added?

Many thanks,
Denis.
fields.summary: Create buttons or macros for frequent tasks
